content.heading: HTML Basic
paragraphs: HTML document structure includes headings, paragraphs, links, images, buttons, and lists.

content.heading: HTML Attributes
paragraphs: Common attributes include title, href, width, height, and alt.
Attributes can be included without quotes, but this may not work in all cases.

content.heading: HTML Headings
paragraphs: HTML headings range from <h1> to <h6>, with <h1> being the largest.

content.heading: HTML Paragraphs
paragraphs:
Use

for paragraphs. Line breaks can be controlled with the
tag.

content.heading: HTML Styles
paragraphs: HTML allows for inline styles, background colors, text colors, fonts, and alignment.

content.heading: HTML Text Formatting
paragraphs: Use <strong> for strong emphasis, <em> for italics, and <u> for underlining.

content.heading: HTML Quotations and Citations
paragraphs: Use <blockquote> for long quotes and <cite> for works.

content.heading: HTML Comments
paragraphs: Comments can be added using <!-- comment here -->.

content.heading: HTML CSS
paragraphs: You can apply CSS inline, internally, or externally to style your HTML.

content.heading: HTML Links
paragraphs: Links are created with the <a> tag using the href attribute.

content.heading: HTML Images
paragraphs: Images are added with tag using src and alt attributes.

content.heading: HTML Tables
paragraphs: Tables are created using <table>, <tr>, <td>, and <th> tags.

content.heading: HTML Lists
paragraphs: Use <ul> for unordered lists and <ol> for ordered lists.

content.heading: HTML Block and Inline Elements
paragraphs: Block elements start on a new line, while inline elements do not.

content.heading: HTML Div Element
paragraphs: The <div> element is used as a container for other elements.

content.heading: HTML Classes
paragraphs: Classes allow you to apply the same styles to multiple elements.

content.heading: HTML Id
paragraphs: The id attribute is unique to each element and can be styled or accessed with JavaScript.

content.heading: HTML Layout
paragraphs: Layout can be achieved using float, flexbox, and grid.

content.heading: HTML IFrame
paragraphs: IFrames allow you to embed another HTML page within your page.

content.heading: HTML Head Elements
paragraphs: Head elements define metadata, scripts, and styles for the document.

content.heading: HTML Scripts
paragraphs: Scripts can be inserted using the <script> tag.

content.heading: HTML Computercode Elements
paragraphs: Use <code> for code snippets and <pre> for preformatted text.

content.heading: HTML Forms
paragraphs: Forms are created using the <form> tag, and can include various input types.

content.heading: HTML Form Elements
paragraphs: Input types include text, radio, checkbox, and dropdown lists.

content.heading: HTML Input Types
paragraphs: Various input types allow for text, numbers, dates, and more.

content.heading: HTML Input Attributes
paragraphs: Attributes like placeholder, required, and min/max enhance input fields.

content.heading: HTML Canvas Graphics
paragraphs: Use <canvas> to draw graphics with JavaScript.

content.heading: HTML SVG Graphics
paragraphs: SVG is used for vector graphics in HTML.

content.heading: HTML Media
paragraphs: Media elements like <audio> and <video> allow you to embed sound and video.

content.heading: HTML Geolocation
paragraphs: JavaScript can be used to get the user's geolocation.

content.heading: HTML Local Storage
paragraphs: Local storage allows you to store data on the client's browser.
